content: Roman Empire. The Roman Empire was a vast and powerful state that controlled a large portion of the western world at that time. It was founded in 27 BC and lasted until the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476 AD. During the first century AD, the Roman Empire was at the height of its power and influence, and its territories stretched from modern-day England and Wales in the north, to Egypt in the south, and as far east as present-day Turkey. The Roman Empire was known for its military might, its system of governance, and its architectural and cultural achievements.
